result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C. Benn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/full time schooling or a combination thereof.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason C. Benn

Case called: 11:31am
State appears by ADA L.Gramer.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Richard Lawson.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (1st Degree Child S.A./Contact w/Child under 13)>>AMEND to State DC pursuant to 947.01
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (DC)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 year probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with victim M.M.H. unless approved by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof; CC.

State notes that no sex offender rules or treatment will be part of probation - COURT agrees and enters as order.
In the event of any revocation, defendant is entitled to 52 days credit.

records.addlTxt: Case Called: 10:43am. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Richard Lawson. Atty Lawson filed Mtn to Dismiss yesterday. Crt proceeds with Mtn to Dismiss. Arguments by Defense & State. COURT makes findings and denies Mtn to Dismiss. Crt proceeds with Prelim. Detective Kelly Hanousek sworn & testifies - identifies defendant. Arguments by State & Defense. Information filed. W/R. PLEA: NOT GUILTY. Atty Lawson files Request for Substitution- crt grants. Bond to Continue. Adjourned: 11:20am.

Preliminary Hearing on March 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): M.M.H. or minors under 18 years of age. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
